lead_paragraph: Louisiana State defensive end Kirston Pittman was granted a sixth year of eligibility by the N.C.A.A., the university announced. Pittman, who missed the 2005 and 2006 seasons with foot and ankle injuries, formally applied for an extension in early January. Pittman, who played 13 games as a freshman and helped lead L.S.U. to a national title, returned to the field in 2007 to help the Tigers win another championship. He started all 14 games and led the team in tackles for a loss.
